===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|くす|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=くす}}. Cognate with the ''kusu'' root of adjective {{m|ja|奇し|tr=kusushi||mystical}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>, from the way that drugs and medicines would have mystical effects.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|くす}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くす|kyu=藥}}

# A [[medicine]] or [[drug]].

=====Usage notes=====
Only used in compounds.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|薬す|くすす}}: to treat someone or something using medicines or drugs {{qualifier|archaic}}
* {{ja-r|薬らう|くすらう}}: to treat someone or something using medicines or drugs {{qualifier|may imply over a longer period of time; archaic}}
* {{ja-r|薬|くすり}}: a medicine or drug {{qualifier|see below}}
* {{ja-r|薬子|くすこ}}: an [[unmarried]] [[young woman]] serving at the [[imperial]] [[court]] who tastes the ceremonial [[spiced]] [[sake]] at [[New Years]]
* {{ja-r|薬師|くすし}}: a [[doctor]] {{qualifier|archaic}}
* {{ja-r|薬師指|くすしゆび}}: archaic alternate for {{ja-r|薬指|くすりゆび}}: the [[ring finger]]
* {{ja-r|薬玉|くすだま}}: an [[ornamental]] [[scented]] [[ball]] made of flowers or other [[aromatic]]s, displayed in early May
* {{ja-r|薬殿|くすどの}}: during the [[w:Heian period|Heian period]], the [[consultation]] [[office]] of the [[court]] [[physician]]
* {{ja-r|薬練|くすね}}, {{ja-r|薬煉|くすね}}, {{ja-r|天鼠矢|くすね}}: [[pine]] [[sap]] boiled in [[oil]] to make a strong [[resin]] used to [[reinforce]] [[bowstring]]s and other things
* {{ja-r|薬練糸|くすねいと}}, {{ja-r|薬煉糸|くすねいと}}: a [[string]] with ''kusune'' applied to it
* {{ja-r|樟|くすのき}}, {{ja-r|楠|くすのき}}: the [[camphor]] [[tree]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|くすり|yomi=k}}
Derivation from ''kusu'' above. Appears to be the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or noun form}} of hypothetical verb ''kusuru'' “to have a mystical effect”.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|くすり|acc=0|dev=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くすり|kyu=藥}}

# A [[substance]] with [[mystical]] [[properties]], especially one that has an effect on the [[body]], [[health]], or [[lifespan]].
# A [[medicine]] or [[drug]], a [[pharmaceutical]].
# A [[chemical]], generally [[toxic]] and used for its effect on living organisms, such as [[insecticide]] or [[herbicide]].
# A [[substance]] that has a [[beneficial]] effect in improving or maintaining one's [[health]].
# {{lb|ja|sort=くすり|figurative}} Something that has a beneficial effect in correcting one's [[mistake]]s.
# {{abbreviation of|釉薬|tr=uwagusuri|dot=:|lang=ja}} A [[glaze]] or [[enamel]] applied to [[ceramic]]s.
# [[gunpowder|Gunpowder]] (from the “mystical substance” sense, and the second character in the word {{m|ja|火薬|tr=kayaku||gunpowder}}).
# {{lb|ja|sort=くすり|figurative}} A small [[bribe]].

=====Usage notes=====
The [[medicine]] sense is probably the most common in modern Japanese.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|薬子|くすりこ}}: an [[unmarried]] [[young woman]] serving at the [[imperial]] [[court]] who tastes the ceremonial [[spiced]] [[sake]] at [[New Years]]
* {{ja-r|薬師|くすりし}}: a [[doctor]] {{qualifier|archaic}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=on|やく}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=やく}} {{zh-l|藥|tr=yak|drug, medicine}}. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} {{zh-l|藥|tr=joek6}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=on|やく|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|やく|kyu=藥}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=やく|slang}} A [[medicine]] or [[drug]], especially a [[narcotic]] or other [[recreational]] drug.

=====Usage notes=====
The slang meaning is generally limited to when the term ''yaku'' is used as a standalone noun. In compounds, ''yaku'' refers more generally to [[pharmaceutical]]s, or sometimes [[chemical]]s.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|薬液|やくえき}}: a [[liquid]] [[medicine]]
* {{ja-r|薬園|やくえん}}: a [[field]] or [[garden]] for cultivating [[medicinal]] [[plant]]s, especially during the [[w:Edo period|Edo period]]
* {{ja-r|薬害|やくがい}}: [[harm]] caused by a [[medicine]] or [[drug]]
* {{ja-r|薬学|やくがく}}: [[pharmacology]], the [[study]] of [[pharmacy]]
* {{ja-r|薬学者|やくがくしゃ}}: a [[pharmacologist]]
* {{ja-r|薬局|やっきょく}}: a [[pharmacy]], a [[pharmacist]]'s office
{{der-bottom}}
